citation.article-title: Pantoea vagans sp. nov., Pantoea eucalypti sp. nov., Pantoea deleyi sp. nov. and Pantoea anthophila sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pantoea eucalypti sp. nov.
Pantoea eucalypti (eu.ca.lyp′ti. N.L. gen. n. eucalypti of Eucalyptus, referring to the host from which the first strains where isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, short rods (0.9×1.5–3.0 μm) occurring singly or in pairs, motile and non-spore-forming.
Colonies are beige to yellow with a darker centre, round, convex and smooth with entire margins.
Indole, H2S and urease are not produced.
Acid is produced from l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-rhamnose, inositol, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, lactose and sucrose.

The following carbon sources are utilized at 28 °C within 3–6 days: l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, maltotriose, l-rhamnose, inositol, aesculin, d-mannitol, maltose, trehalose, cellobiose, lactose, sucrose, glycerol, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-tartrate, succinate, fumarate, l-aspartate, l-glutamate, cis- and trans-aconitate, l-proline, d- and l-alanine, l-serine, Tweens 40 and 80 and citric acid.

The following carbon sources are not utilized at 28 °C within 3–6 days: erythritol, d-adonitol, l-sorbose, dulcitol, d-sorbitol, amygdalin, inulin, raffinose, lactulose, glycogen, xylitol, turanose, d-tagatose, l-arabitol, 2-ketoglutarate, 5-ketogluconate, l-fucose, 3-O-methyl-d-glucopyranose, d-tartrate, l-tryptophan, l-histidine, glutarate, malonate, propionate, l-tyrosine, gentiobiose and malonic acid.
The G+C content of the type strain is 54.5 mol%.
The type strain is R-25678T (=LMG 24197T =BCC 076T =BD 769T), isolated from eucalyptus in Uruguay.
Strains belonging to this species have been isolated from eucalyptus leaves showing symptoms of bacterial blight and die-back in Uruguay.
